Class IpDAO

  • java.lang.Object
    • IpDAO

  • public class IpDAO
extends java.lang.Object
    IpDAO class

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.util.List<Address> myList 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      IpDAO()
      IpDAO constructor instantiates the IpDAO class
      IpDAO(java.lang.String fileName)
      IpDAO method attempts to create a file named by the contents of "fileName" variable, if file already exists, and error message is displayed to console

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void createRecord(Address address)
      createRecord instantiates an Address object, while the for loop checks the entered shortIp attribute against the previously stored records.
      void deleteRecord(Address address)
      deleteRecord(Address address) method takes an address and deletes that address from the list of records
      void deleteRecord(int id)
      deleteRecord(int id) method matches input to preexisting address id attribute, address record is removed from the list of records
      protected void readList()
      readList() method reads stored records from file named by fileName variable and attempts to assign record attributes to a new Address
      Address retrieveRecord(int id)
      retrieveRecord method attempts to return a record with an ID attribute that matches user input
      java.lang.String toString() 
      void updateRecord(Address updatedAddress)
      updateRecord method passes attributes into preexisting Address record
      protected void writeList()
      writeList() method formats address atributes and writes them to a file named by the string stored in fileName variable

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

      • myList

        protected final java.util.List<Address> myList

    • Constructor Detail

      • IpDAO

        public IpDAO()
        IpDAO constructor instantiates the IpDAO class
        Parameters:
        ipdata.txt - Name of the file that will house stored records. Specifically, this is passed into IpDAO(String fileName) method

      • IpDAO

        public IpDAO(java.lang.String fileName)
        IpDAO method attempts to create a file named by the contents of "fileName" variable, if file already exists, and error message is displayed to console

    • Method Detail

      • createRecord

        public void createRecord(Address address)
        createRecord instantiates an Address object, while the for loop checks the entered shortIp attribute against the previously stored records.
        Parameters:
        currentEntry.getNumAccess()+1 - Adds "1" to the numAccess attribute of the original record when a duplicate ip entry is detected by the for loop

      • retrieveRecord

        public Address retrieveRecord(int id)
        retrieveRecord method attempts to return a record with an ID attribute that matches user input
        Returns:
        If the for loop successfully matches an ID, the address is returned. Should the for loop fail, null(substance of nothing) is returned

      • updateRecord

        public void updateRecord(Address updatedAddress)
        updateRecord method passes attributes into preexisting Address record

      • deleteRecord

        public void deleteRecord(int id)
        deleteRecord(int id) method matches input to preexisting address id attribute, address record is removed from the list of records

      • deleteRecord

        public void deleteRecord(Address address)
        deleteRecord(Address address) method takes an address and deletes that address from the list of records

      • readList

        protected void readList()
        readList() method reads stored records from file named by fileName variable and attempts to assign record attributes to a new Address

      • writeList

        protected void writeList()
        writeList() method formats address atributes and writes them to a file named by the string stored in fileName variable

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
